RautSoft.plot
Class JFreeChartPanel

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Window
              java.awt.Frame
                  javax.swing.JFrame
                      RautSoft.plot.JFreeChartPanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
public class JFreeChartPanel
extends javax.swing.JFrame

Plots on a ChartPanel one or more functions of one variable. 

 import static RautLib.util.RautSoftChart.*;
 import Interfaces.*;
 
 plot(ff,x0,x1, legends);
 
 For plotting multiple functions, 
 ff is a vector of FunctionOfOneVariable type functions
 x0 is a double vector of starting points of these functions
 x1 is a double vector of end points of these functions
Example: (For plotting a function) 
 FunctionOfOneVariable f = new FunctionOfOneVariable() {
 public double value(double x){return x*x;} };
 plotLegend = "f(x)= x*x";
 plot(f , -100.0,100.0);
Example2: For plotting multiple functions 
  FunctionOfOneVariable f0 = new FunctionOfOneVariable() {
             public double value(double x){return L(1,x);} };
             
       FunctionOfOneVariable f1 = new FunctionOfOneVariable() {
              public double value(double x){return L(2,x);} };
             
       FunctionOfOneVariable f2 = new FunctionOfOneVariable() {
              public double value(double x){return L(3,x);} };
             
           
       FunctionOfOneVariable f3 = new FunctionOfOneVariable() {
             public double value(double x){return L(4,x);} };
                  
             FunctionOfOneVariable [] ff = new FunctionOfOneVariable[4];
             ff[0] = f0;
             ff[1]=f1;
             ff[2] = f2; 
             ff[3]=f3;
             double [] x0 ={0,0,0,0};
             double [] x1 ={8.0,8.0,8.0,8.0};
             String [] legends= {"T1(x)", "T2(x)", "T3(x)", "T4(x)"}; 
             
               plotTitle = "Plotting Laugerre polynomials of various degrees";
             plot(ff,x0,x1, legends);

Method Detail

plot

public static void plot(FunctionOfOneVariable f,
                        double x0,
                        double x1)
It plots a function of one variable, or a set of funcitons of one variable. You can specify the range of the plot using x0 and x1, and also you can control what should appear in the legend using the specifying a legend command.

Parameters:
x0 - a double vector (for one function a scalar) of initial points
x1 - a double vector (for one function a scalar) of end points
f - FunctionOfOneVariable either a vector or a scalar
